thread.title: Prep roundup: White's goals help ACS move on in boys' soccer playoffs
thread.title_full: Prep roundup: White's goals help ACS move on in boys' soccer playoffs

author: Times-News
title: Prep roundup: White's goals help ACS move on in boys' soccer playoffs
text: Posted Oct. 21, 2015 at 12:47 AM Updated at 12:53 AM Posted Oct. 21, 2015 at 12:47 AM Updated at 12:53 AM GRAHAM — Chandler White scored a pair of goals for Alamance Christian School as the Warriors recovered from an early deficit to defeat visiting Bethel Christian Academy of Kinston 4-2 on Tuesday in the quarterfinals of the North Carolina Christian School Association Class 2-A state playoffs for boys’ soccer. Jonathan Brann scored at the 24-minute mark to draw the Warriors even at 1-1 after Owen Tyndall put Bethel Christian ahead with a goal off a penalty kick in the 16th minute. Graham Doucette scored in the 34th minute to give ACS the lead and White added his insurance goals at the 47- and 79-minute marks. Goalkeeper Ben Rorrer recorded five saves for ACS (14-2-1), which advances to Friday’s semifinals in Raleigh to face Wilmington Christian Academy (14-6). Michael Fulcher added a second-half goal and Trey Chase had six saves for Bethel Christian Academy (10-6-1). ■ GREENSBORO PAGE 5, SOUTHERN ALAMANCE 1: At Mt. Hermon, Zach Cates scored for the Patriots late in the second half but the damage had been done as visiting Greensboro Page defeated Southern Alamance in an All Metro Conference game. Chris Giacobello had six first-half saves and Seth O’Neil stopped five shots in the second half for the Patriots (8-7-1, 3-3-0). Volleyball At Mebane, Eastern Alamance swept visiting Williams High School 25-18, 28-26, 25-18 in the semifinals of the Mid-State 3-A Conference tournament to set up a final matchup with regular-season champion Northern Guilford. Katie Price had 17 assists while Bailey Dollar added 15 digs to lead the Eagles (17-7). Tonight’s final pits teams that split the regular-season series, with Northern Guilford claiming a 3-2 victory at home and Eastern Alamance handing the Nighthawks their lone conference loss 3-1 in Mebane. ■ BARTLETT YANCEY 3, GRAHAM 0: At Yanceyville, host Bartlett Yancey wasted little time in advancing to the Mid-State 2-A Conference Tournament final with a 25-12, 25-11, 25-14 victory against Graham in the semifinals. Alexia Matias (17 assists), Sequoia Evans (15 assists) and Sydney McCann (eight digs, four kills) led the Red Devils (7-13). Bartlett Yancey (13-8) will play host to league regular-season champion Carrboro (23-2) in tonight’s final. ■ GREENSBORO GRIMSLEY 3, SOUTHERN ALAMANCE 1: At Greensboro, the Whirlies defeated Southern Alamance in four sets in an All Metro Conference Tournament semifinal match. ■ BURLINGTON CHRISTIAN ACADEMY 3, CAROLINA FRIENDS 1: Amanda Carden had 10 kills and eight aces to lead BCA past visiting Carolina Friends 25-14, 25-7, 19-25, 25-19 in the quarterfinals of the Triad Athletic Conference Tournament. Page 2 of 2 - Ashton Hamlett and Camille Abbott added seven kills apiece for the Royals. ■ CALDWELL ACADEMY 3, THE BURLINGTON SCHOOL 0: At Greensboro, Caldwell Academy swept The Burlington School 25-8, 25-8, 25-8 in the quarterfinals of the Triad Athletic Conference Tournament. Emma McQueen had six assists and four digs to pace the Spartans (4-15). By Times-News
